meanings.definition: To bind or compel someone to do something
meanings.sent1: The teacher obligates the students to complete their homework on time.
meanings.sent2: The contract obligates both parties to fulfill their responsibilities.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous elf obligates the sleepy cat to play with a ball of yarn.
meanings.sent4: Kindness obligates us to help those in need, like a silent promise.
meanings.sent5: The bright sign obligates drivers to slow down for safety.

meanings.definition: To make someone feel morally or legally bound to do something
meanings.sent1: His promise obligates him to keep his word and be honest.
meanings.sent2: The law obligates citizens to pay their taxes on time.
meanings.sent3: The funny clown obligates the audience to laugh with his silly antics.
meanings.sent4: Love obligates us to care for each other, like an unbreakable bond.
meanings.sent5: The warning sign obligates visitors to wear helmets for protection.
